text: (upbeat music)

- [Instructor] Setting up
Amazon WorkSpaces Thin Client
is easy, and in just a few simple steps,

you'll be connected to your AWS
End User Computing services.

Let's start by ensuring you
have all the included items.
(upbeat music)
Connect the wired or wireless adapters
for your keyboard and mouse,

and optionally, your
wired headset and webcam
to the USB-A ports on the hub.

Then connect the secondary
monitor to the HDMI port.

Connect the power adapter
to the power port.
Now, you can connect your hub and monitor
to your Amazon WorkSpaces Thin Client.
(upbeat music)
Use an HDMI cable to connect the HDMI port
on your primary monitor
to the HDMI outport on the Thin Client.
Next, connect the USB-A plug from your hub
to the USB port on your Thin Client.

Now, connect your Thin
Client power adapter
to the power port.
(upbeat music)
Plug the power cords into a power outlet.

Once powered on, follow
the onscreen instructions
to connect to the service.

If you are connecting via
wifi, have your password ready.
First, select the language.

Then select your keyboard
type from the options shown.

You'll now connect your
Amazon WorkSpaces Thin Client
to your network.

Once it scans for available
wireless networks,

select your network
from the dropdown list.
The final step is logging in
to your AWS End User Computing desktop

using the instructions
from your IT administrator.

Once logged in, you can
access your application
on your remote desktop service.
